title: 114_hr3637
content: The Act may be cited as the "HIV Clinical Services Improvement Act" and Medicaid payment for services provided by Ryan White Part C grantees will be on a cost-based prospective payment system. The "HIV Clinical Services Improvement Act" amends the Social Security Act to provide Medicaid payment for services by Ryan White Part C grantees starting in fiscal year 2016. The "HIV Clinical Services Improvement Act" amends the Social Security Act to provide Medicaid payment for services by Ryan White Part C grantees starting in fiscal year 2016. The State plan shall provide payment for services in 2016 based on the grantee's costs in fiscal years 2014 and 2015, or as determined by the Secretary. The State plan shall provide payment for services in fiscal year 2017 and beyond based on the previous year's amount adjusted for MEI increase applicable to primary care services. The State plan shall provide payment for Medicaid covered services furnished by new grantees in the first fiscal year, equal to 100 percent of the costs based on rates established for other grantees in the same area. The State plan provides payment for Medicaid covered services by new grantees in the first fiscal year, based on rates established for other grantees in the same area or adjacent area with a similar case load. For subsequent fiscal years, payment amounts are calculated according to specific regulations. In cases of managed care, the State plan includes supplemental payments to grantees based on contracts with managed care entities. The State plan allows for supplemental payments to grantees for Medicaid covered services, based on agreed payment schedules and alternative payment methodologies determined by the State and the grantee. The State plan allows supplemental payments to grantees for Medicaid covered services based on agreed payment schedules and alternative payment methodologies. Grantees must meet quality management and reporting requirements comparable to Federally-qualified health centers to receive payment. The amendments made by subsection (a) will apply to services furnished on or after January 1, 2016, regardless of final regulations. State plans for medical assistance may require legislation to meet additional requirements imposed by the amendments. The Act requires an additional requirement to be met before the first day of the first calendar quarter following the close of the State legislature's regular session. If a State has a 2-year legislative session, each year is considered a separate regular session.
